title: Meaning Making: How a Mentor Can Help Authors Find Their "Authentic Voice"
description:
Ann Bridges is not only an accomplished author, but she also mentors authors who are trying to uncover their true voice and she helps them navigate the publishing world. Here she tells her story and we discuss the philosophy of language, the soul-deep purpose of writing, and how to "pull" great stories and great writing from creative people. Ann introduced me to Reggie Gibbs, one of those authors she has mentored. Reggie has been on the Meaning Code twice now discussing his novel of war, Russian philosophy and Eastern Orthodoxy.

Ann's Amazon page with all of her books:
https://www.amazon.com/Ann-Bridges/e/B00V7D9VAE%3Fref=dbs_a_mng_rwt_scns_share

Author ANN BRIDGES
Connecting Generations through Novel Ideas

website: https://AuthorAnnBridges.wordpress.com 
NEW: Mercury’s “Fake” Message – A Novella Approach to Critical Thinking
Non-fiction: Groundbreaking! America's New Quest for Mineral Independence
        (co-authored with Dr. Ned Mamula)
The Silicon Valley Series of Novels: Private Offerings* and Rare Mettle
        *Named 2015 Best Business Fiction by Wealth Management Magazine
The Daring California Series of Novels: Kit's Mine
